Shcha (Ğ© Ñ‰; italics: Ğ© Ñ‰) is a letter of the Cyrillic script. In Russian, it represents the voiceless alveolo-palatal fricative /É•(Ë)/, like the pronunciation of âŸ¨shâŸ© in sheep (but longer). In Ukrainian and Rusyn, it represents the consonant cluster /ÊƒtÍ¡Êƒ/. In Bulgarian, it represents the consonant cluster /Êƒt/. In Kurdish, it represents the consonant /dÍ¡Ê’/. In English, Shcha is romanized as âŸ¨shchâŸ© or âŸ¨Å¡ÄâŸ© (with haÄeks), both reflecting the historical Russian pronunciation of the letter.
